Challenge System Commands.name: add-points
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to automatically add points to a participant's challenge to the Challenges database.

Challenge System Commands.name: autoadd-members
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to automatically add participants to the Challenges database.

Challenge System Commands.name: leaderboard
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives users the ability to see the top 10 users on the leaderboard and also their position on the leaderboard.

Challenge System Commands.name: challenge
Challenge System Commands.description: This command allows **mods** to add additional challenge questions to the Challenge System.

Challenge System Commands.name: check-participants
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to check who has the participants role in their server.

Challenge System Commands.name: clear-points
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **mods** the ability to mark a submission as unreviewed.

Challenge System Commands.name: edit-challenge
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **mods** the ability to edit the challenge questions that get asked.
Challenge System Commands.example: ++ec 5 What type of pizza is Erin's favorite?

Challenge System Commands.name: edit-submission
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives users the ability to edit the submission answers that they previously submitted. If you need your message ID, contact one of the Challenge Moderators and they can get that for you.

Challenge System Commands.name: end-challenge
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **mods** the ability to end the challenge that was just being played.

Challenge System Commands.name: add-user
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to manually add users to the participants database.

Challenge System Commands.name: mod-check-submissions
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to check who has submitted a response.

Challenge System Commands.name: purge-submissions
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **Erin** the ability to purge all submissions from the submissions database. *Note:* This does *not* delete them from the channel within discord.

Challenge System Commands.name: remove-user
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to manually remove users to the participants database.

Challenge System Commands.name: remove-points
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to automatically remove points from a participant's challenge in the Challenges database.

Challenge System Commands.name: remove-submissions
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows **mods** to remove responses to challenges.

Challenge System Commands.name: reviewed
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **mods** the ability to review submissions.

Challenge System Commands.name: start-challenge
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **mods** the ability to start a challenge by storing the prizes for 1st, 2nd and 3rd place as well as the announcements channel ID.

Challenge System Commands.name: submit
Challenge System Commands.description: This is how users can submit answers to the challenge questions.
Challenge System Commands.example:
```++submit 1```language
//code here```
additional information here.
```
Please remove the spaces between the backticks before language and after `//code here`. If you are submitting a link, please use this format: ```++submit 1 https://github.com``` Meaning keep it all on the same line. Not formatting it this way will cause issues with our system.

Challenge System Commands.name: unreview
Challenge System Commands.description: This gives **mods** the ability to mark a submission as unreviewed.

Challenge System Commands.name: user-check-submissions
Challenge System Commands.description: This allows users to check see what submissions that they have made and provides them with their message ID.

Admin Commands.name: createcommands
Admin Commands.description: Allows Erin to create the Slash Commands.

Admin Commands.name: deletecommands
Admin Commands.description: Allows Erin to delete the Slash Commands.

General Commands.name: help
General Commands.description: This allows users to find out more information on all of our commands.

Admin Commands.name: bot-status
Admin Commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a bot update
Admin Commands.example: /bot-status Fixed a bug in the help command

Admin Commands.name: enable-challenge-system
Admin Commands.description: Enables the challenge system and creates necessary database tables

Admin Commands.name: disable-challenge-system
Admin Commands.description: Disables the challenge system for this server

Admin Commands.name: disable-system
Admin Commands.description: Disables a bot system (challenges, suggestions, reports, thanks)

Admin Commands.name: dm
Admin Commands.description: Sends an official DM to a specified user

Admin Commands.name: enable-system
Admin Commands.description: Enables a bot system (challenges, suggestions, reports, thanks)

Admin Commands.name: server-status
Admin Commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a server update
Admin Commands.example: /server-status New channels added for Python discussions

Admin Commands.name: site-status
Admin Commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a website update

Admin Commands.name: sub-status
Admin Commands.description: Pushes an embed to display in the channel about a subreddit update
Admin Commands.example: /sub-status New rules added to the subreddit

Admin Commands.name: system-status
Admin Commands.description: Shows the status of all bot systems

Information Commands.name: career
Information Commands.description: Allows users to get information on how to get careers in the IT field.

Information Commands.name: djs
Information Commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Discord.js Discord Server

Information Commands.name: ddev
Information Commands.description: Sends a link to join the Discord Developers Discord Server

Information Commands.name: djslangfirst
Information Commands.description: Asks users to learn JavaScript before trying to learn Discord.js

Information Commands.name: dom-listening
Information Commands.description: Sends information about why not to use dom listening attributes/properties.

Information Commands.name: dpy
Information Commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Discord.py Discord Server.

Information Commands.name: editors
Information Commands.description: Sends information on commonly used IDEs or Text Editors.

Information Commands.name: freelance
Information Commands.description: Allows users to get information on how to self employment or freelancing.

Information Commands.name: nojquery
Information Commands.description: Sends information on why JQuery isn't used and is bad to use.

Information Commands.name: noscreens
Information Commands.description: Sends information on why it is best to avoid sending screenshots of your code.

Information Commands.name: react
Information Commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Reactiflux Discord Server

Information Commands.name: smallhosting
Information Commands.description: This is a small snippet from our `/largehosting` command.

Information Commands.name: vla
Information Commands.description: Sends info on what a VLA is and why is it bad?

Information Commands.name: w3c
Information Commands.description: Informs our users why they should avoid w3schools like the plague.

Information Commands.name: webassembly
Information Commands.description: Sends an invite link to the Web Assembly Discord Server.

Message Issue Commands.name: bin
Message Issue Commands.description: Tells people a few places they could go to share long pieces of code.

Message Issue Commands.name: elaborate
Message Issue Commands.description: Asks people to elaborate by including code or by including more information.

Message Issue Commands.name: error
Message Issue Commands.description: Tells people to post the full stack trace.

Message Issue Commands.name: faq
Message Issue Commands.description: Tells users to check out our FAQ channel and docs to get their simple questions answered.

Message Issue Commands.name: format
Message Issue Commands.description: Asks people to format their code with backticks or by sharing their code on places like pastebin.com

Message Issue Commands.name: gettinganswers
Message Issue Commands.description: Sends information on how to ask better questions.

Message Issue Commands.name: hire
Message Issue Commands.description: Refers people to the request-coders channel to hire someone.

Message Issue Commands.name: rules
Message Issue Commands.description: Asks users to make sure they are following the rules.
Message Issue Commands.usage: /rules @username or user ID rule number[1-5] or /rules @username or ID all
